game

Class SidePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • game.SidePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class SidePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The SidePanel stores all the components of the side panel while the user is playing the game.
    Version:
    1.0, May 28 2014. (added panel to the side, the main menu, pause and sound buttons. Sound button not yet functional), 1.1, May 30 2014. (Fixed null pointer exception described in MenuFrames and added ActionListener to sound.), 1.2, June 4, 2014. (Music now does not lose focus of the game.), 1.3, June 6, 2014. (Prompts user for name before returning to main menu. Option to cancel and return to game if main menu clicked.), 1.4, June 8 2014. (Moved component implementation from constructor to private method.), 1.5, June 10 2014. (Sound button actually shows whether the music is on or off, javadoc)
    Author:
    Anqi Wu, Chusa Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SidePanel

        public SidePanel(GameWindow game)
        The class constructor. The constructor sets the panel specifications, adds the buttons with the specifications, and sets the class's layout manager. Each button has own ActionListener object.
        Parameters:
        game - GameWindow - The current instance of GameWindow being used is passed through.

    • Method Detail

      • setComponents

        private void setComponents()
        The "setComponents" method, which declares and adds the various components to the panel. This method creates each JButton, adds ActionListener objects, and declares their specifications (location, size, etc). There are three anonymous classes that implement ActionListener. The first listens for when the main menu button is pressed and then asks the user if they want to save their score and then returns them to the main menu. The second listens for when the pause button is pressed and then pauses the game. Finally, the third listens for when the sound button is pressed and then turn the sound on or off.
        Parameters:
        e - - ActionEvent - The ActionEvent object.
